intro: Keckiella cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf keckiella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
